title: Ronnie Burgess
text:
Ronnie Burgess (March 7, 1963 – January 4, 2021) was an American professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="defensive%20back">defensive back</a> for the <a href="Green%20Bay%20Packers">Green Bay Packers</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Wake%20Forest%20Demon%20Deacons%20football">Wake Forest Demon Deacons</a>.
Biography.
Burgess was born on March 7, 1963 in <a href="Sumter%2C%20South%20Carolina">Sumter, South Carolina</a>, and was a graduate of <a href="Sumter%20High%20School">Sumter High School</a>. He died on January 4, 2021, in <a href="Socastee%2C%20South%20Carolina">Socastee, South Carolina</a>, after a cardiac arrest related to medical issues stemming from a car accident in late 2019. He was 57 years old.
Career.
Burgess played college football at <a href="Wake%20Forest%20University">Wake Forest University</a> and was drafted by the <a href="Green%20Bay%20Packers">Green Bay Packers</a> in the tenth round of the <a href="1985%20NFL%20Draft">1985 NFL Draft</a>. He played seven games for the Packers in 1985 and retired after that season.
After football.
Burgess served as an <a href="assistant%20principal">assistant principal</a> at <a href="Carolina%20Forest%20High%20School">Carolina Forest High School</a>, and was a long-time administrator with <a href="Horry%20County%20Schools">Horry County Schools</a>, having previously served as <a href="principal%20%28education%29">principal</a> of <a href="Myrtle%20Beach%20High%20School">Myrtle Beach High School</a>, <a href="St.%20James%20High%20School%20%28South%20Carolina%29">St. James High School</a>, and the <a href="Academy%20for%20the%20Arts%2C%20Science%20and%20Technology">Academy for the Arts, Science and Technology</a>.
